content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #86106 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
A performance regression in a common case, but not an atrocious one. It's not critical. I'd tentatively suggest P-medium or P-high?
I'm not sure if this can be expensive, if it can, P-high should be reasonable.
It's a move instruction from one register to another. I know very little about performance, but I'd think that should be a very cheap operation?
yes, I think so but mentioned it just in case I overlooked an edge case
I mean, if it can, P-high should be reasonable (otherwise I'd go for P-medium)

By looking at the mentioned PR #81451, the upgrade to LLVM12 revealed some perf losses. Not sure if the perf run also is showing the regression in this issue.
I also have no great context here but I tend to bring perf issues on the table of the team compiler meeting and have more eyes on them rather than underestimate (better safe than sorry).
So I'd say tentatively P-high and possibly downgraded after the team's judgement call
